text: the philosopher Plato once said music

to everything music has always been a

involved with every musical Fine Arts
event
music surrounded me it made me who I was
and it gave me a place to belong now
I've always had this thing with rhythms
I remember being young I would walk down
the hallways of my school and I would
tap rhythms to myself on their leg with

nervous habit and I was always nervous I
think I like the repetition of the
rhythm
it was calming then in high school I
started music theory and as the best
class I've ever taken we were learning
about music things I didn't know like
theory and history it was a class where
we basically just listened to a song
talked about what it meant to us and
analyzed it and figured out what needed
take and every Wednesday we did
something called rhythmic dictation and
I was pretty good at it our teacher
would give us an amount of measures and
then time signature and then she would
speak a rhythm to us and we would have
to write it down with the proper rest
and notes like this tah-tah-tah-tah
tah-tah ticka ticka ticka ticka and i
loved it the simplicity of the rhythm of
basic two to four measure line and
each of them almost told a story like
they had so much potential and all you
had to do was add a melody rhythm set a
foundation for melodies and harmonies
the plan top of it gives structure and
stability the music has these parts
rhythm melody and harmony just like our

to remember what to do and to stay on
track and to just keep going and you may
not notice it but it's always there
it may seem simple it may seem dull by

and then sings in your life let on to it
giving textures as your friends and your

anything that makes it polyphonic and
they create beautiful chords and pattern
and then the view you play on top of

throw the song melody develops but it's

and I went to college and everything

wrong
sometimes I loved it and it was great
but other times I felt like I had been

it goes being washed away

I could hear it
and I could feel it and it was me and I

now I know this is only one of many

Michio Kaku once explained this an
